action: Extremely high levels of intense action, thrilling battles and action-packed fight scenes
adventure: Travelling and undertaking an adventure in a certain place or around the world
cars: All about cars and anything to do with them running in the 90s
comedy: If it fails to make you laugh or at least make you giggle, then it's a failure
crime: Bad guys everywhere, the protagonist has to protect everyone
dementia: Do you know who else has dementia? Do you know who else has dementia?
demons: Demons, from biblical backgrounds or Japanese culture are here
detective: Characters working to solve a crime scene
drama: Whether it's a tickle of emotion or a barrage of feelings, the goal is to touch your heart
ecchi: When you want hentai but mom said you have hentai at home
family: Anime for all of the family
fantasy: Fantasy worlds, surreal events and locations
game: As long as it concerns any playable game of any kind, it belongs in this category
gender-bender: When the protagonist has a gender-crisis
harem: More than two female characters go head-over-heels for a single male character
historical: Revolves around events in history and moments of antiquity
isekai: Transported to a similar world to ours, but diffierent and usually comes with magic
iyashikei: A sub-genre of slice-of-life that heals you
josei: Targets female viewers around the age range of 18-40
kids: Mild, light, and insightful, which makes them perfect for children 12 and under
magic: Stuff like spells and incantations. It can also include magical sources, beings that grants wishes, and good ol' sleeve tricks
martial-arts: Shows that are primarily focused on martial arts itself and their battle techniques
mecha: You'll never see a mecha anime without a robot or mechanical suit in it
military: Involves the military in one way or another
music: These shows typically focus on singing, dancing, or playing musical instruments
mystery: Whether it's an event, a place, or an item, there's some sort of mystery surrounding the narrative
parody: Countless numbers of other anime references are showcased throughout the plot
police: Emphasizes the life and struggles of law enforcement in their line of duty
psychological: Shows that delve into how the mind and psyche work
romance: All about love and sweet moments
school: If a school is the primary setting and the anime deals mostly with school and student life
sci-fi: Showcases scientific and technological elements in its story
seinen: Specifically targets male viewers around the age range of 18-40
shoujo: Specifically targets female viewers around the age range of 10-18
shoujo-ai: Meaning "girl's love", typically young female characters show love and affection for each other
shounen: Specifically targets male viewers around the age range of 10-18
shounen-ai: Meaning "boy's love", typically young male characters show tender affection for each other
super-power: Expect an array of explosive super powers scrambling right on the screen
supernatural: Events that are odd and out-of-the-blue
suspense: Not quite a thriller, but puts you on the edge of your seat
thriller: Puts you on the edge of your seat and on the verge of having a heart attack
time-travel: Traveling back or forwards in time
vampire: A creature from folklore that subsists by feeding on the vital essence of the living
